intro: Rhexia glutinosa, commonly known as stickyleaf sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its sticky, glandular leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features include alternate, heart-shaped leaves and a flowering period that occurs in late spring to early summer. Rhexia glutinosa is a member of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other species with similar morphological traits.
